instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, green/orange light but no spin-up
threads.message:
I've got a liquid damaged (but pre-cleaned) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that isn't spinning up.  The liquid damage _appears_ to have been pooling around the edge of the board with some residual grubbiness around the SMC and the RAM chips.  

The G3H rails are present and the green->orange charger light is as normal.

An oddity is that <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> oscillates between 3.3 and 3.42v.

The <SIGNAL>PPV5_S5</SIGNAL> rail is present but again it oscillates.  This time between 3.6 and 5v.  

no other power rails are active.

on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> I'm getting lows on EN and EN1 and on EN2 I'm getting an oscillating 0-3v. 

any ideas of where to hunt please?

thanks
justin

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, green/orange light but no spin-up
threads.message:
Replace <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and see if it fixes the problem VRTC should be 3.3 steady.
If it does not, next places to check would be <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8, the SPI ROM traces and termination resistors and the JTAG. But you need to steady out the clock voltage first

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, green/orange light but no spin-up
threads.message: First thing is to find out where the pulsing is coming from. Is PPBUS even stable at 8.6V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, green/orange light but no spin-up
threads.message:
Yes. The 8.6 and 3.42 rails are rock solid. 

The signals to the dual mosfet gate are pulsing too, although the lower gate is only oscillating between 0-200mV.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, green/orange light but no spin-up
threads.message: I don't have a spare clock chip but I'm not sure that the rtc is not ok . Pin 8 on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is pp3v42 which is stable.  I will check the spi bus but again - this feels like a different kind of issue on the S5 5v regulator circuit. Like a diode failing as a cap discharges perhaps.
